#define PC_START   0

PC index at SIVM startup

Definition at line 20 of file sivm.h.

#define SP_INCR   -1

SP incrementation Set it to (+)1 to go through ascending adresses, -1 to go through descending adresses. Standard operation is found by setting SP_START at MEMSIZE and this variable to -1 (descending adresses).

Definition at line 29 of file sivm.h.

Referenced by instr_pop(), instr_push(), and sivm_new().

int  memsize,
cmd_word  mem[memsize] 
)

Loads the given program in the given SIVM.

Returns:
false if the SIVM's memory is too small to load the whole program, true if the loading was successful.

void sivm_new ( SIVM *  sivm  ) 

Initializes a new ProcSI virtual machine.

Author:
Me
Initializes an SIVM. Inits PC, SP and SR registers to the values defined in the SIVM.h file. Inits all memory and registers of the SIVM to 0.

bool sivm_step ( SIVM *  sivm  ) 

Executes the next instruction in the given SIVM.

See also:
sivm_exec

increment_PC

Returns:
true if the instruction was correctly executed, false if the SIVM has to stop (whether on HALT instruction or because of a bad instruction).
